member.summary: Creates an authentication from a key.

member.summary: Creates an empty authenticate.

member.name: T:nanoFramework.WebServer.AuthenticationAttribute
member.summary: Authentication attribute for classes and method

member.name: P:nanoFramework.WebServer.AuthenticationAttribute.AuthenticationMethod
member.summary: The authentication method, examples: - Basic:user password - Basic - ApiKey:OneApiKey - ApiKey - None In case of Basic and ApiKey alone, the default one passed at server properties ones will be used The Basic authentication is a classical http basic authentication and the couple user password have to be separated with a space, the password can contain spaces but not the user name. Basic and the user name has to be separated with a : ApiKey and the current apikey has to be separated with : The current ApiKey can contain only characters that are allow in http headers

member.summary: The constructor for the Authentication attribute

member.summary: No authentication is needed.

member.summary: Basic authentication with user and password.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets the data.

member.summary: Gets the file name.

member.summary: Gets the name.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.WebServer.HttpMultipartParser.FilePart.ContentType
member.summary: Gets the content-type. Defaults to text/plain if unspecified.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.WebServer.HttpMultipartParser.FilePart.ContentDisposition
member.summary: Gets the content-disposition. Defaults to form-data if unspecified.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.WebServer.HttpMultipartParser.FilePart.AdditionalProperties
member.summary: Gets the additional properties associated with this file. An additional property is any property other than the "well known" ones such as name, filename, content-type, etc.

member.name: T:nanoFramework.WebServer.HttpMultipartParser.HeaderUtility
member.summary: Provides parsing headers from a Http Multipart Form

member.name: M:nanoFramework.WebServer.HttpMultipartParser.HeaderUtility.ParseHeaders(System.String,System.Collections.Hashtable)
member.summary: Reads headers from a line of text. Headers are delimited by a semi-colon ';' Key-value pairs are separated by colon ':' or equals '=' Values can be delimited by quotes '"' or not
member.param: The line of text containing one or more headers
The hashtable that will receive the key values. Passed in since a Multipart Part can contain multiple lines of headers

member.name: T:nanoFramework.WebServer.HttpMultipartParser.LineReader
member.summary: Provides methods to read a stream line by line while still returning the bytes.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The input stream to read from.
The buffer size to use for new buffers.

member.name: M:nanoFramework.WebServer.HttpMultipartParser.LineReader.ReadByteLine(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reads a line from the stack delimited by the newline for this platform. The newline characters will not be included in the stream.
member.param: If true the newline characters will be stripped when the line returns. When reading binary data, newline characters are meaningfull and should be returned
member.returns: The byte[] containing the line or null if end of stream.

member.name: M:nanoFramework.WebServer.HttpMultipartParser.LineReader.ReadLine
member.summary: Reads a line from the stack delimited by the newline for this platform. The newline characters will not be included in the stream.
member.returns: The containing the line or null if end of stream.

member.name: T:nanoFramework.WebServer.HttpMultipartParser.MultipartFormDataParser
member.summary:
Provides methods to parse a
multipart/form-data
stream into it's parameters and file data.

member.name: M:nanoFramework.WebServer.HttpMultipartParser.MultipartFormDataParser.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class
member.param: The stream containing the multipart data.
The size of the buffer to use for parsing the multipart form data.
By default the parser will throw an exception if it encounters an invalid part. Set this to true to ignore invalid parts.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.WebServer.HttpMultipartParser.MultipartFormDataParser.Files
member.summary: Gets the mapping of parameters parsed files. The name of a given field maps to the parsed file data.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.WebServer.HttpMultipartParser.MultipartFormDataParser.Parameters
member.summary: Gets the parameters. Several ParameterParts may share the same name.

member.name: M:nanoFramework.WebServer.HttpMultipartParser.MultipartFormDataParser.Parse(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Parse the stream into a new instance of the class
member.param: The stream containing the multipart data.
The size of the buffer to use for parsing the multipart form data.
By default the parser will throw an exception if it encounters an invalid part. Set this to true to ignore invalid parts.
member.returns: A new instance of the class.
